headline: FedEx profit to be dragged down by US tariffs on previously exempt parcels
summary: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) -FedEx will report a quarterly profit hit from President Donald Trump's decision to end tariff-exempt treatment for popular direct-to-consumer shipments when the global delivery firm reports results on Thursday, analysts said.  FedEx's fiscal first quarter, which ended on August 31, captures the impact from the May 2 end of "de minimis" exemptions for packages from China and Hong Kong.  The U.S. also removed de minimis exemptions for the rest of the world on August 29, with full financial effects yet to come.
